Applicants must be eligible to work in the specified location
Role Overview

We are seeking an experienced Digital Project Manager to lead the delivery of a critical train scheduling and planning systems replacement project across multiple Train Operating Companies.

The successful candidate will oversee the full project life cycle-from procurement and requirements gathering through to system implementation, migration, and post-deployment support-ensuring delivery is on time, on budget, and aligned with business objectives.

This is a hands-on role requiring strong leadership, excellent stakeholder management, and deep experience in software delivery projects.

Key Responsibilities

Lead the procurement, replacement, and migration of a Legacy train planning system.

Develop and maintain detailed project plans, timelines, and resource allocations.

Define scope, goals, deliverables, and success criteria.

Coordinate cross-functional teams including developers, QA, analysts, and business stakeholders.

Oversee testing, acceptance, and user training.

Monitor risks, dependencies, and issues, implementing mitigation strategies.

Produce Steering Committee reports and provide regular progress updates.

Ensure compliance with standards, regulations, and security protocols.

Deliverables

Comprehensive Project Plan with tasks, dependencies, and resources.

Regular status and risk reports.

Training materials and documentation for end users.

Post-Implementation Report with outcomes and recommendations.

Essential Skills & Experience

5+ years of project management experience, ideally in software/application projects.

Strong background in application migrations, replacements, or integrations.

Solid understanding of Agile, Waterfall, and SDLC methodologies.

Proficiency with project management tools (eg, Jira, MS Project, Trello).

Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills.

Strong analytical and problem-solving ability.

PMP, PRINCE2, or Agile certification (preferred).

Please feel free to apply if you meet the criteria.
